definition: used before a singular countable noun when you are talking about one person or thing that has not been mentioned before
example: I see a cat. She has an apple.
a few minutes, a few times, a few years
Good idea!, It’s a good idea to…, That’s a good idea!
a little help, a little money, a little sugar
a lot to do

definition: a large number or amount of something
example: There are a lot of books on the table.
We played outside all day.
He studied all night for the test.

definition: in all parts of the earth.
example: She has been all over the world.

definition: any additional or different thing (used in questions or negative statements).
example: Would you like anything else?

definition: any other person (used in questions or negative statements).
example: Does anyone else want to go?
We waited for a short period of time.

definition: in or to many parts of the world.
example: He wants to travel around the world.

definition: to get to a specific point or smaller place (like a station, building, or event).
example: We will arrive at the cinema at 7 o'clock.

definition: to get to a larger area like a city or country.
example: My friends arrive in Paris next week.

definition: to say that you would like to have something; to request something.
example: If you are hungry, ask for a sandwich.

definition: attending school; being present in the school building for learning.
example: The children are at school from 9 a.m. to 3 p.m.
We sing a song at the beginning of the class.

definition: in the final part of an event or activity.
example: At the end, everyone clapped.

definition: in the final part of something (like a period of time, a story, or a place).
example: They get paid at the end of the month.
Sorry, she's not here at the moment.

definition: happening together; at the identical moment.
example: They both started talking at the same time.
My older sister is at university.

definition: at the place where you do your job.
example: My dad is at work now.

definition: not near someone or something; at a distance from someone or something.
example: Please keep the dog away from the food.

definition: harmful to someone or something; likely to cause damage or problems.
example: Eating too much sugar is bad for your teeth.

definition: information about something unpleasant that has happened or will happen.
example: I'm afraid I have some bad news for you.

definition: as a result of; used to give a reason for something.
example: The game was cancelled because of the rain.

definition: to start an activity or process with a particular thing or action.
example: Let's begin with the first exercise.

definition: used to talk about future plans or intentions, or to predict that something will happen soon.
example: I am going to visit my grandmother tomorrow. / Look at those clouds! It's going to rain.

definition: a very close friend that you like more than any other.
example: She told her best friend all her secrets.

definition: using only black, white, and shades of grey; not in colour.
example: The old movie was in black and white.

definition: an area or building where cars can be parked.
example: We left the car in the multi-storey car park.
He came into the room.

definition: it is difficult for sb to do sth
find out about sth, find out more

example: I’m getting off here.
Are you getting on?

definition: get ready for sth, get ready to do sth

example: She went into her room.

definition: have time for sth, have time to do sth
It is important for sb/sth to do sth

example: I live in the country.

definition: in the afternoon, in the evening
in the south, in the east, in the west

term: it is important to do sth

example: It takes an hour to get there.
What kind of music do you like?

definition: last month, last summer, last week, last weekend
to have the same opinion as someone
example: I agree with you.

definition: once a month, once a week, once a year
be on the phone, talk on the phone

example: What are your plans for next year?
I really enjoyed it.
I’d really like to…

definition: See you around, See you later, See you soon
spend time doing sth, spend time with sb
stay in a hotel, stay in bed
example: I’m staying in tonight.

definition: there are, there was, there were

example: This is my dad.

definition: work together for sth, work together to do sth
I would like…, I would like to…, Would you like…?
X times a day, X times a week
X days ago, X months ago, X weeks ago
X days later, X minutes later

example: Tell me all about it.

definition: at that time, at the time of sth
check in at…, check sth in
depend on sb/sth for sth, depend on sth
even more difficult, even more exciting

term: find it difficult to do sth

example: Go down the road.
Let me help you.
Look back at your notes.

definition: make sure of sth, make sure that…

example: I didn’t enjoy it at all.
No way!

definition: on the other side of sth
kilometres per hour, miles per hour

example: What sorts of things do you do?
such a good idea

definition: the other side of the world

example: They say you can’t buy happiness.

definition: a great deal better, a great deal of sth

example: I had a kind of feeling this might happen.
as if nothing had happened
What’s going on?

definition: far more important, far more opportunities

example: far too much homework
a job for life

definition: have sth in common with sb, have sth in common with sth
in time for sth, in time to do sth
be in touch, get in touch, keep in touch, in touch with sb

example: I didn’t mean to.
I didn’t even see it.

definition: on their own, on your own
a day or two, a moment or two, a pound or two
point sth out, point out that…
quite a good player, quite a long time
relating to sth/sb, related to sth/sb

example: a rise in the number of visitors

definition: take up too much room, take sth up, take up golf

example: There are those who say…

definition: be to do with sb/sth, have to do with sb/sth

example: up to 60 miles per hour

definition: a means of communication, a means of transport

term: as far as I am concerned
at the end of the day

definition: both sides of the argument, on both sides

example: a dream come true
a decline in student numbers
The train got in late.
You’ll get over it.
She went off to get a drink. A bomb went off. The alarm went off. The lights went off.

term: in an attempt to do sth

definition: no matter how…, no matter what…

example: prices ranging from €25 to €60

definition: when it comes to doing sth

term: as far as sb/sth is concerned

definition: as to how…, as to whether…
bear in mind that…, keep sb/sth in mind, keep in mind that…
call on sb to do sth
have sb/sth in mind for sth

term: have nothing to do with sb/sth
definition: be nothing to do with sb/sth

term: in a position to do sth

example: How shall I put it?
his best work to date
